from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import * 
#import pyspark.pandas as ps

account_name = "jessicaadls"
container_name = "jessica"
relative_path = "titanic"
adls_path = 'abfss://%s@%s.dfs.core.windows.net/%s' % (container_name, account_name, relative_path)



data = spark.read.option('header', 'true').option('delimiter', ',').csv(adls_path + '/titanic.csv')

#Now normal pandas dataframe, not spark
data = data.toPandas()

data.head()

# filter by sex and select only females
data_females = data[data['Sex'] == 'female']
#sort from highest fare
#data_females = data_females.withColumn("Fare", data_females["Fare"].cast(IntegerType()))
data_females.sort_values('Fare',inplace=True, ascending=False)
# save data to same datalake, use different filename

data_females.head()

# pd to Spark DF

df = spark.createDataFrame(data_females)
df.write.csv(adls_path + "/titanic_females.csv")
